Learn at least basic business practice before criticizing with certainty.

replies.author: @randomstring-u8p
replies.text: My apartment building has people on section 8 driving Mercedes and BMWs, also the repo guys are always snatching those cars.  I live in a nice building but the law requires a certain amount of section 8 units.  Since my city is highly corrupt, leftist city, it's usually criminals that get these units i.e. they pay someone off to get bumped on the list and placed in a nice building.  All my neighbors and I have ring cams, we call the cops and know them on a first name basis so they get arrested and evicted a lot until a new one lands in one of those units.  They rarely last 6 months.  They pay the first month then squat.  Dirty entitled people.

author: @JohnDaker_singer
text: Once at Home Depot I neglected to scan a paintbrush. I had a bunch of stuff that I bagged up, and when I got out to my truck, I saw the paintbrush laying at the bottom of the cart. My heart raced, and I looked around for loss control to come arrest me. I put my purchases in my truck, turned around and walked back into the store and paid for the paintbrush. I felt terrible. I had put myself in a bad position, but I did what I had to do to make it right. could I have been arrested for that? Yes. That makes me much more diligent when I use self check out.

author: @captainobvious-CH
text: In Lausanne, Switzerland, we just had 2 days of riots over the death of the son of migrants from Congo. I have no idea under what pretext they were allowed to stay here. Not actual asylum seekers. Anyway, this 17 year old dumbass was riding a stolen scooter. Trying to evade a police patrol that had identified his scooter as stolen, he killed himself. He threw his life away so he would not have to face a short police interactions and a stern talking-to about not stealing stuff from some prosecutor who would let him go, anyway. His parents obviously claimed that he didndu noting and that they had never seen no stolen scooter. Unfortunately, certain individuals keep confirming that a certain Gauss curve is shifted to the left.

author: @JustaGuy_Gaming
text: Why I hate self check out, garbage like this. Sure the guy is most likely guilty but I have also seen stories of old grandmas who forgot to scan a candy bar getting prosecuted by Walmart as well. They treat every mistake at Self check out as a criminal act. Mean while if you went to a normal check out and the cashier messed up, it's their fault not yours. Your not going to jail because they typed in the wrong  code for a Vine Ripe Tomato.

author: @nothinghere494
text: In Nacogdoches Texas in 2022 the Police Chief was found to be stealing from the city by using the city credit card to make purchases from Amazon near daily. A local attorney said characterized the offenses as felony theft and the internal reports state ‚ÄúIt was common knowledge throughout segments of the department that Amazon packages arrived almost daily for Sevey,‚Äù Police Chief Sevey received no criminal complaint and was paid a 6 month salary with benefits and has retired into the Texas Hill Country do pursue woodworking, probably using the items he bought with the city credit card in his shop. It is refreshing to see a police department that is committed to integrity.
